text:
I recently had a disappointing experience at hougang village wet pasar the vegetable stall. It appears that the cashier (auntie) has been charging inconsistently. For the exact same items, I received two different receipts with different weights and prices — which is quite troubling.

During my visit, I was charged $72, which seemed unusually high, as I typically spend around $50 for a similar amount of groceries. I requested a receipt and reviewed it item by item with my helper, but no matter how we checked, the total didn’t make sense.

To clarify, we queued again with the same items and asked the auntie to weigh and calculate everything once more. The second receipt was different — fewer items were listed, and items like coriander and spring onions, which were previously given for free, were now charged an additional $2. Even after this second calculation, the total came to $71 — still inconsistent and unclear.

What’s most concerning is that the same items were weighed and priced differently between the two receipts. This kind of discrepancy feels careless at best and dishonest at worst. I hope the management will look into this and ensure fair and transparent pricing for all customers. Thanks
Interesting place. Came 10pm and coffee shops and few shops were still opened. The parking slots were full though. I didn't know at the first place and parked at the other block but it was better.

Wet market comprising different stalls selling fresh vegetables, fish, poultry and others.

While people of all demographics visit this place, it is a gathering place and support group for the boomers. My elderly mother works here as well.

Hougang Village is a neighborhood center in Singapore, known for its laid-back atmosphere and community vibe. It serves as a convenient hub for residents, offering a mix of shops, dining options, and essential services. The area features a variety of eateries, from traditional hawker fare to modern cafes, catering to diverse culinary tastes. Hougang Village also includes markets and retail outlets that provide everyday essentials, making it a favorite spot for locals. The neighborhood is well-connected by public transport, enhancing its accessibility. With its blend of convenience and charm, Hougang Village remains a vibrant gathering place for the surrounding community.
Various shops from Fair Price to the fruit market provide options for household shopping.
